VoteLikeAMadre Privacy Policy

Last Updated:Â August 31st, 2020

This website collects personal information in two different ways, and the information collected by each method is subject to a specific privacy policy:
â
1.When you register and/or make a plan to vote using the ACRONYM tool, the information you provide is collected by ACRONYM and subject to its privacy policy.
2.When you enter information in response to the âpinky promise to voteâ pop-up submission form, it is subject to Latino Victory Projectâs privacy policy for this site.
â
By tagging photos using #VoteLikeAMadre, the user grants the brand VoteLikeAMadre (and those they authorize) a royalty-free, nation-wide, perpetual, non-exclusive license to publicly display, distribute, reproduce and create derivative works of the submissions, in whole or in part, in media now existing or later developed, for any purpose, including, advertising and promotion on VoteLikeAMadre and Latino Victory Project websites and social channels.
â
In addition, this website may use cookies, web beacons and other analytics tools and technologies to collect anonymized information about your use of the site. This information is subject to Latino Victory Projectâs privacy policy for this site.[NOTE: if there is general information collected for all users, such as anonymized info on who clicks where used for analytics, you should include disclosures about that here. This language just covers the treatment of PII.]

LATINO VICTORY PROJECT PRIVACY POLICY
â
Last Updated: August 28, 2020
â
This Privacy Policy explains how information about you is collected, used and disclosed by Latino Victory Project. This Privacy Policy applies to information we collect when you use our website, mobile application and other online products and services that link to this Privacy Policy (collectively,
the âSiteâ).
â
We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time. If we make changes, we will notify you by revising the date at the top of the policy and, in some cases, we may provide you with additional notice (such as adding a statement to our homepage or sending you an email notification). We encourage you to review the Privacy Policy whenever you access the Site to stay informed about our information practices and the ways you can help protect your privacy.
â
COLLECTION OF INFORMATION
Information You Provide to Us
â
We collect information you provide directly to us. For example, we may collect information when you make a donation, request information, fill out a form, send us an email, sign up to receive updates, sign up for an event, apply for or inquire about a job or internship, make a purchase, or otherwise communicate with us. The types of information we may collect include your name, email address, postal address, phone number, credit card information, and other information you choose to provide. In addition, the Federal Election Commission (FEC) may require us to collect personal information from political donors. For example, the FEC requires us to collect the name, mailing address, occupation, and employer of all individuals whose political donations exceed $200 per calendar year. Information We Collect Automatically When You Use the Site When you access or use our Site, we automatically collect information about you, including:
â
â Log Information: We log information about your use of the Site, including the type of browser you use, access times, pages viewed, your IP address and the page you visited before navigating to our Site.
â Device Information: We collect information about the computer or mobile device you use to access our Site, including the hardware model, operating system and version, device identifiers and mobile network information.
â Information Collected by Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies: We use various technologies to collect information, and this may include sending cookies to your computer or mobile device. Cookies are small data files stored on your hard drive or in device memory that helps us to improve our Site and your experience, see which areas and features of our Site are popular and count visits. We may also collect information using web beacons (also known as âtracking pixelsâ). Web beacons are electronic images that may be used in our Site or emails and help deliver cookies, count visits, understand usage and campaign effectiveness and determine whether an email has been opened and acted upon. For more information about cookies, and how to disable them, please see âYour Choicesâ below. Information We Collect From Other Sources We may also obtain information from other sources and combine that with information we collect through our Site.
â
USE OF INFORMATION
â
We may use information about you for various purposes, including to:
â
â Provide, maintain, and improve our Site;
â Provide the information you request and to process and complete your donations, registrations, purchases and related transactions;
â Request feedback and otherwise contact you about your use of the Site;
â Respond to your emails, submissions, questions, comments, and requests and to provide customer service;
â Send you updates and newsletters and otherwise provide you with information about our organization or that we think will be of interest to you, such as sending you news and information to keep you informed about various campaigns, candidates, issues, events, resources, promotions, products and services;
â Solicit volunteers, donations and support for our organization and for candidates, issues and organizations that we support;
â Send you technical notices, updates, confirmations, security alerts and support and administrative messages and otherwise facilitate your use of, and our administration and operation of, the Site;
â Monitor and analyze trends, usage and activities in connection with our Site;
â Link or combine with information we get from others to help understand your needs and provide you with better information and
â Carry out any other purpose for which the information was collected.
â
Latino Victory Project is based in the United States and the information we collect is governed by
U.S. law. By accessing or using the Site or otherwise providing information to us, you consent to the
processing and transfer of information in and to the U.S. and other countries.
â
SHARING OF INFORMATION
â
We may share information about you as follows or as otherwise described in this Privacy Policy:
â
â With vendors, consultants and other service providers or volunteers who need access to such information to carry out work on our behalf.
â To report required information to the Federal Elections Commission, if applicable, including name, mailing address, occupation, and name of employers of individuals whose political contributions exceed $200 in a calendar year (for additional information, visit the FEC website at http://www.fec.gov);
â With organizations that facilitate the registration of voters;
â With organizations, candidates, campaigns, groups or causes that we believe have similar political viewpoints, principles or objectives or share similar goals as Latino Victory Project, and with organizations that facilitate communications and information sharing among such
groups;
â With candidates or organizations to whom you have made a donation through the Site;
â In response to a request for information if we believe disclosure is in accordance with any applicable law, regulation or legal process, or as otherwise required by any applicable law, rule or regulation;
â If we believe your actions are inconsistent with the spirit or language of our user agreements or policies, or to protect the rights, property and safety of Latino Victory Project or others;
â In connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, reorganization, sale of assets, financing or acquisition or in any other situation where personal information may be disclosed or transferred as one of the assets of Latino Victory Project; and
â With your consent or at your direction, including if we notify you through our Site that the information you provide will be shared in a particular manner and you provide such information. We may also share aggregated or anonymized information that does not directly identify you.
â
SOCIAL SHARING FEATURES
â
The Site may offer social sharing features and other integrated tools (such as the Facebook âLikeâ button), which let you share actions you take on our Site with other media, and vice versa. The use of such features enables the sharing of information with your friends or the public, depending on the settings you establish with the entity that provides the social sharing feature. For more information about the purpose and scope of data collection and processing in connection with social sharing features, please visit the privacy policies of the entities that provide these features.
â
ANALYTICS SERVICES PROVIDED BY OTHERS
â
We may use third parties to provide us with analytics services. These entities may use cookies, web beacons and other technologies to collect information about your use of the Site and other websites, including your IP address, web browser, pages viewed, time spent on pages, links clicked and conversion information. This information may be used by Latino Victory Project and others to, among other things, analyze and track data, determine the popularity of certain content, deliver content targeted to your interests on our Site and other websites and better understand your online activity.
â
SECURITY
â
Latino Victory Project takes reasonable measures to help protect information about you from loss, theft, misuse and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration and destruction.
â
YOUR CHOICES
Cookies
â
Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, you can usually choose to set your browser to remove or reject browser cookies. Removing or rejecting browser cookies does not necessarily affect third party flash cookies used in connection with our Site. To delete or disable flash cookies please visit www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer/security for more information. Please note that if you choose to remove or reject cookies, this could affect the availability and functionality of our Site.
â
Promotional Communications
â
You may opt out of receiving text messages, updates and newsletters by following the instructions in those emails or text messages by unsubscribing here, contacting us at info@latinovictory.us. If you opt out, we may still send you other types of emails, such as those about your use of the Site or any donations or transactions.
â
CONTACT US
â
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at: info@latinovictory.us
â
Vote Like a Madre "ACRONYM" Privacy Policy

Last Updated: February 12, 2020
â
makeaplan.votelikeamadre.org is an ACRONYM program, and this Privacy Policy explains how ACRONYM (âACRONYMâ) collects, uses and discloses information about you through the makeaplan.votelikeamadre.org website and any other websites, mobile applications, and other online services that link to this Privacy Policy (collectively, the âServicesâ), or when you otherwise interact with us. We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time. If we make changes, we will notify you by revising the âLast Updatedâ date at the top of this policy and, in some cases, we may provide you with additional notice (such as by adding a statement to our homepage or sending you a notification). We encourage you to review our Privacy Policy whenever you access the Services to stay informed about our information practices and the choices available to you.

Collection of Information
Information You Provide to Us

We collect information you provide directly to us. For example, we collect information when you use the Services for voter registration outreach purposes, sign up to receive email updates or other notifications (such as SMS alerts), fill out a form, make a donation, send us an email, request information, sign up as a volunteer, sign a petition, use our voter registration tools and look-up tools, participate in interactive areas or features of the Services, or otherwise communicate with us. The types of information we collect may include name, email address, phone number, date of birth, registration status, social media handles or usernames, and other information you choose to provide. In some cases, you may provide your social security and/or driverâs license numbers, but we do not retain this information.
â
In addition, you may choose to import your address book contacts or enter your contactsâ information manually in connection with your use of certain features of the Services, such as those feature that help you identify with which of your contacts you would like to engage for voter registration purposes. Please note that we do not store any of your address book contacts or any third-party contact information you manually provide through the Services in a persistent manner, and you will need to import or enter such information each time you use the Services. Automatically Collected Information When you access or use the Services, we automatically collect information about you, including:
â
â Log Information: We collect log information about your access to and use of the Services, such as your web browser, access times, pages viewed, Internet Protocol (âIPâ) address, links clicked, and the page you visited before navigating to the Services.
â Device Information: We may collect information about the computer or mobile device you use to access the Services, including the hardware model, operating system and version, unique device identifiers, and mobile network information.
â Information Collected by Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies: We use various technologies to collect information, including cookies and web beacons. Cookies are small data files stored on your hard drive or in device memory that help us improve the Services and your experience on the Services, see which areas and features of the Services are popular, and count visits. Web beacons are electronic images that may be used on the Services or in emails and help us to deliver cookies, count visits, understand usage and campaign effectiveness, and determine whether an email has been opened and acted upon. For more information about cookies, and how to disable them, please see the âYour Choicesâ section below.
â
Information We Collect From Other Sources
â
We may obtain information from other sources and combine that with information we collect through the Services. For example, we may use publicly available voter registration information to help determine whether you or other individuals you know are registered to vote. In addition, we and our service providers may collect voter file data and other information about you from outside sources, such as state parties and other democratic organizations, data exchanges, public databases, and private organizations.
â
Use of Information
â
We may use information that we collect for various purposes, including to:
â Provide, maintain, and improve the Services, including to assist you in determining voter registration status and in voter registration efforts;
â Facilitate your communications with your contacts and other individuals you know in connection with voter registration and other initiatives that are supported or otherwise promoted through the Services;
â Provide and deliver the information you request, and send you related information such as confirmations and updates;
â Send you technical notices, updates, security alerts, and support and administrative messages;
â Respond to your emails, submissions, comments, questions and customer service requests, request feedback, and otherwise contact you about your use of the Services;
â Send you newsletters, and otherwise provide you with information or services you request or that we think will be of interest to you, such as sending you information to keep you informed about voting and other issues, events, resources, promotions, contests, products and services;
â Help connect you with other individuals, volunteers or supporters, and to solicit volunteers for issues and organizations we support;
â Contact you if we need to obtain additional information in order to comply with applicable laws;
â Monitor and analyze trends, usage and activities in connection with the Services;
â Personalize and improve the Services, and provide advertisements, content or features that match user profiles or interests or that are based on the information you provide or the actions you take; and
â Carry out any other purpose for which the information was collected.
â
Sharing of Information

We may share information about you as follows or as otherwise described in this Privacy Policy:
â With vendors, consultants, and other service providers or volunteers who need access to such information to carry out work on our behalf;
â With organizations that facilitate the registration of voters;
â With candidates, organizations, campaigns, groups or causes that we believe have similar political viewpoints, principles or objectives or share similar goals as ACRONYM, and with organizations that facilitate communications and information sharing among such groups;
â When we believe in good faith that we are lawfully authorized or required to do so or that doing so is reasonably necessary or appropriate to comply with the law or legal processes or to respond to lawful requests, claims or legal authorities, including responding to lawful subpoenas, warrants, or court orders;
â If we believe your actions are inconsistent with the spirit or language of our user agreements or policies, or to protect the rights, property and safety of ACRONYM, its employees, volunteers, constituents or others;
â In connection with, or during negotiations of, any reorganization, formation of a successor organization, asset sale or transfer, financing or lending transaction or in any other situation where information may be disclosed or transferred as one of the assets of ACRONYM;
â With your consent or at your direction, including if we notify you through the Services or otherwise that the information you provide will be shared in a particular manner and you provide such information.
â
We may also share aggregated or anonymized information that does not directly identify you.

Links to Other Websites

The Services may contain links to other websites. For example, we may link to a third-party website to enable you or other individuals to register to vote or make a donation, or to help organize volunteers through a third-party website for our benefit, or we may link to the websites of other organizations with whom we partner. Any information you provide on such third-party websites is provided directly to the third party that operates the third-party website and is subject to that third party's privacy policy. This Privacy Policy does not apply to such linked sites, and we are not responsible for the content or privacy and security practices and policies of such third-party websites. We encourage you to learn about the
privacy and security practices of the third parties that operate the third-party websites that are linked from the Services and to review their privacy and other policies before providing them with information.
â
Social Sharing Features
â
The Services may offer certain social sharing features and other integrated tools (such as the Facebook âLikeâ button), which let you interact with ACRONYMand share actions you take on the Services via third-party social media sites. The use of such features enables the sharing of information with your friends or the public, depending on the settings you establish with the entity that provides the social sharing feature. For more information about the purpose and scope of data collection and processing in connection with social sharing features, please visit the privacy policies of the entities that provide these features.
â
Advertising and Analytics Services Provided by Others
â
We may allow third parties to use cookies, web beacons, or other technologies or otherwise collect information about you in order to provide analytics and advertising services, including serving ads on the Services or on other sites based on your visits to the Services and other sites across the Internet. These entities may collect or receive information about your use of the Services and other websites, including your IP address, browser, device information, pages viewed, time spent on pages, links clicked, and conversion information. This information may be used by ACRONYM and others to, among other things, analyze and track data, determine the popularity of certain content, deliver advertising and content targeted to your interests, and better understand your online activity.
â
For more information about interest-based ads, or to opt out of having your web browsing information used for behavioral advertising purposes, please visit www.aboutads.info/choices. In addition, your device may include a feature (such as âLimit Ad Trackingâ on iOS or âOpt Out of Interest-Based Adsâ or âOpt Out of Ads Personalizationâ on Android) that allows you to opt out of having certain information collected through applications used for behavioral advertising purposes.
â
Security
â
ACRONYM takes reasonable measures to help protect information about you from loss, theft, misuse and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration and destruction.
â
Transfer of Information to the United States and Other Countries
â
ACRONYMis based in the United States and the information we collect is governed by United States law. By accessing or using the Services or otherwise providing information to us, you consent to the processing and transfer of information in and to the United States and other countries.
â
Your Choices
Cookies
â
Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, you can usually choose to set your browser to remove or reject browser cookies. Please note that if you choose to remove or reject cookies, this could affect the availability and functionality of the Services.
â
Promotional Communications
â
You may opt out of receiving updates, newsletters and other promotional communications by email by following the instructions in those emails, and you may opt out of receiving SMS alerts by texting STOP at any time. If you opt out, we may still send you non-promotional communications, such as those about your use of the Services or any of your donations or transactions.
â
Mobile Notifications and Alerts
â
With your consent, we may send promotional and non-promotional push notifications or alerts to your mobile device. You can deactivate these messages at any time by changing the notification settings on your mobile device.
â
Contact Us
â
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at weare@anotheracronym.org.

WHATâS IN IT FOR KIDS WHEN YOU #VoteLikeAMadre?

Theyâll have
a stable life.

There are already such big hurdles to succeed in our country. Now, climate change threatens to make that even harder for our kids. More storms, floods, droughts, and disasters will slow the economy and make a safe, stable life harder to come by.

THEYâLL BREATHE
FRESH AIR.

Growing up, outside was our playground. Itâs crazy to think that pretty soon that might not be an option for our kids. Pollution is giving them lung problems like asthma and making the days too hot to play outside.

THEY'LL LIVE IN A WORLD FILLED WITH LIFE.

Biodiversity is what makes life on earth possible. All the things we love in nature rely on a diverse ecosystem. But that chain is breaking down, with dozens of species and plants going extinct every day and never coming back.

el instinto de una madre never fails,

But hereâs a little help
in case it does.

What to look for in a good climate plan:

Acknowledges climate change is real and human-made.

Toxic red tides, heat waves, water shortages, wildfires, stronger stormsâthese are just some of the changes threatening our communities because of the heat-trapping pollution in the atmosphere. It doesn't get more real than this. We need a leader who sees that, trusts science and acts on it.

Holds big polluters accountable.

Oil, gas, and coal companies have known about the effects of burning fossil fuels for decades. Instead of protecting our communities, they just kept on polluting. We need to stop bailing these companies out and invest in clean energy technologies instead.

protects vulnerable communities.

56 million Latinos in the U.S. are especially vulnerable to the effects of climate change. Big polluters set up their plants in our backyards, putting our kids more at risk for asthma and other diseases. Any good climate plan will deliver environmental justice and force big polluters to pay for the damage they're doing to our communities.

Make your madre vote count
